intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. istrogenes, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with lanceolate to ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, smooth achenes as seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
